sep.gaia.resources.poi

Class POIFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.poi.POIFilter

  • public class POIFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a set of conditions a POI must fulfill to be part of the system with the respective filter. Those conditions are stored as key-value-pairs as they are used by the Overpass-API and are thus defining attributes the POIs must have. For the values of the attributes POSIX-extended regular expressions can be used.
    Author:
    Matthias Fisch (specification), Matthias Fisch (implementation)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      POIFilter()
      Initializes an empty filter.
      POIFilter(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> limitations)
      Initializes the Filter with the limitations defined by the key-value-pairs in limitations, where the value is expected to be a POSIX-extended regular expression.

      • POIFilter

        public POIFilter()
        Initializes an empty filter.

      • POIFilter

        public POIFilter(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> limitations)
        Initializes the Filter with the limitations defined by the key-value-pairs in limitations, where the value is expected to be a POSIX-extended regular expression.
        Parameters:
        limitations - The key value-pairs.

    • Method Detail

      • addLimitation

        public void addLimitation(java.lang.String key,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Adds a attribute a POI must have to be part of the system with this filter.
        Parameters:
        key - The key (name) of the attribute to add.
        value - The value of the attribute to add. This parameter is treated as a regular expression.

      • isMatching

        public boolean isMatching(PointOfInterest poi)
        Checks if the attrbutes in poi fulfill the conditions of this filter.
        Parameters:
        poi - The POI to check.
        Returns:
        true if poi meets the criteria of this filter. Otherwise false is returned.

      • isMatching

        public boolean isMatching(java.util.Collection<PointOfInterest> pois)
        Checks if the attributes of any of the POIs in pois fulfill the conditions of this filter.
        Parameters:
        pois - The POIs to check.
        Returns:
        true if all POIs in pois meet the criteria of this filter. Otherwise false is returned.

      • isExactlyMatching

        public boolean isExactlyMatching(PointOfInterest poi)
        Checks if the attrbutes in poi fulfill the conditions of this filter. In contrary to isMatching() this method only returns true if poi has no other attributes than those specified by this filter.
        Parameters:
        poi - The POI to check.
        Returns:
        true if and only if poi meets the criteria specified by this filter.

      • isExactlyMatching

        public boolean isExactlyMatching(java.util.Collection<PointOfInterest> pois)
        Checks if the attributes of any of the POIs in pois fulfill the conditions of this filter. In contrary to isMatching() this method only returns true if the entries in pois have no other attributes than those specified by this filter.
        Parameters:
        pois - The POIs to check.
        Returns:
        true if all POIs in pois meet the criteria of this filter. Otherwise false is returned.

      • getLimitations

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getLimitations()
        Returns a map associating keys with their respective value defining an attribute of a POI. The values are POSIX-extended regular expressions
        Returns:
        The attributes to be met by a system described by this filter.
